aima.core.logic.common

Class Parser<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.logic.common.Parser<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the root type of the abstract syntax tree being parsed.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PLParser

    public abstract class Parser<S>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract base class for constructing parsers for knowledge representation languages. It provides a mechanism for converting a sequence of tokens (derived from an appropriate lexer) into a syntactically correct abstract syntax tree of the representation language.
    Author:
    Ravi Mohan, Ciaran O'Reilly

      • getLexer

        public abstract Lexer getLexer()
        Returns:
        an instance of the Lexer to be used by a concrete implementation of this class.

      • parse

        public S parse(java.lang.String input)
        Parse the input concrete syntax into an abstract syntax tree.
        Parameters:
        input - a string representation of the concrete syntax to be parsed.
        Returns:
        the root node of an abstract syntax tree representation of the the concrete input syntax that was parsed.

      • parse

        public S parse(java.io.Reader inputReader)
        Parse the input concrete syntax into an abstract syntax tree.
        Parameters:
        inputReader - a Reader of the concrete syntax to be parsed.
        Returns:
        the root node of an abstract syntax tree representation of the the concrete input syntax that was parsed.

      • parse

        protected abstract S parse()
        To be implemented by concrete implementations of this class.
        Returns:
        the root node of an abstract syntax tree representation of the the concrete input syntax that was parsed.

      • lookAhead

        protected Token lookAhead(int i)
        Returns:
        the token at the specified position in the lookahead buffer.

      • consume

        protected void consume()
        Consume 1 token from the input.

      • match

        protected void match(java.lang.String toMatchSymbol)
        Consume the given match symbol if it matches the current input token. If it does not match throws a ParserException detailing the match error.
        Parameters:
        toMatchSymbol - the symbol to match before consuming it.
